p: The Martin group at the University of Texas at Austin reported T. brucei methionyl-tRNA synthetase (MetRS) inhibitors for the treatment of African trypanosomiasis and sleeping sickness [ 56, 57]. Two major classes of compounds incorporating tetracyclic tetrahydro-beta-carboline and 4-amino-2-piperidone were prepared to selectively inhibit the MetRS of T. brucei. The inhibitory activities of three tetracyclic carboline compounds ( 47â€“ 49) were tested for the T. brucei MetRS aminoacylation assay, showing submicromolar IC 50 values as depicted in Figure 17. One of the tetracyclic compounds exhibited no off-target activity when screened against a panel of 45 CNS proteins.
